meanings.definition: To offer or suggest (something) for consideration or acceptance.
meanings.sent1: She propined her idea for the school project.
meanings.sent2: He propined a new plan for the team's strategy.
meanings.sent3: The cat propined a mouse as a gift to its owner.
meanings.sent4: The sun propined its rays to the awakening earth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher propined a fun game to help students learn.

meanings.sent1: They propined their findings at the conference.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer propined the evidence in court.
meanings.sent3: The clown propined a pie for the audience to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The river propined its sparkling waters to the valley.
meanings.sent5: The chef propined a new dish for the menu.

meanings.definition: To recommend or advocate (something) to others.
meanings.sent1: She propined a good book to her friend.
meanings.sent2: He propined a healthy lifestyle to his patients.
meanings.sent3: The magician propined a trick to entertain the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The wind propined the idea of change to the leaves.
meanings.sent5: The scientist propined a new theory to the scientific community.
